Front Desk Officer Job at Interrand Homes & Properties Limited




        
    

        
        Interrand Homes & Properties Limited (subsidiary of Interrand Group) is a reputable Construction and Real Estate Development company with offices in Abuja, Lagos, and Ibadan.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Life Camp and its environs, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage front desk operations and attend to visitors/clients.
	Handle phone calls, emails, and inquiries professionally.
	Maintain office records and assist with administrative tasks.
	Provide excellent customer service and support to the team.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND or equivalent qualification with 2 - 7 years of work experience
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and basic computer operations.
	Must be well-organized, courteous, and punctual.
	Prior experience in a front desk/administrative role is an added advantage.
	Applicants must reside in Lifecamp or its immediate environs for proximity and easy accessibility.


Salary
Attractive and competitive.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: hr@interrandgroup.com using “Application for Front Desk Officer” as the subject of the mail.

Farm Manager Job at Olam Agri




        
    

        
        Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains & oilseeds, animal feed & protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains & seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Farm Manager - Poultry

Job Location: Kaduna

Job Description


	Lead and manage Layer and Broiler Breeder operations, utilizing ultra-modern and automated systems (e.g., closed houses, tunnel ventilation, automatic feeding, automatic egg collection systems) with minimal human intervention.
	Oversee farms to ensure adherence to best-in-class international industry norms.
	Recruit, develop, and train team members, establishing and implementing best practices for brooding and growing, vaccination, health, biosecurity measures, and the performance of broiler parent stock (PS) flocks.
	Develop and implement protocols for body weight and flock uniformity, vaccination, health, biosecurity, labor sanitation practices, feeding, and preventive medication. Create formats for measuring performance parameters.
	Improve project infrastructure to enable efficient utilization of facilities/resources and achieve strong performance with low operating costs.
	Implement and maintain exceptionally high international biosecurity standards.
	Develop reporting formats and conduct regular performance reviews for team members.
	Achieve targets for mortalities, flock uniformity, egg production, Hatching Eggs per hen housed (HE/HH), and reduce the cost of hatching egg production.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Veterinary Sciences / Agriculture Science (Animal Production) or Post-graduation in Veterinary Sciences with a specialization in Poultry Production / Pathology.
	15-20 years of experience across diverse markets, including regions with high levels of automation in closed houses and developing regions (Africa experience preferred). This blend of experience is essential for achieving developed-world standards in Nigeria.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Customer Support Executive",
  "description": "Naira567 is a fast-growing, Nigeria-first sports and iGame platform built for seamless play, fair odds, and fast, reliable payouts. We&rsquo;re a mobile-first, remote-friendly team combining world-class technology with local insight to deliver a safe, entertaining experience for players across Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Support Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	You will handle inbound customer queries and outbound calling to convert prospects thereby, supporting users, driving sign-ups, and elevating player satisfaction.
	This is a high-visibility, growth role with clear performance incentives for outbound conversions.


Key Responsibilities
Inbound Support:


	Respond to tickets, chats, calls, and social DMs within SLAs; resolve issues (account, KYC, deposits/withdrawals, bets, promotions, basic troubleshooting).
	Investigate and escalate complex cases to Risk, Payments, Tech, or Compliance; follow through to closure.
	Capture accurate case notes and user feedback to improve FAQs and product.


Outbound Growth &amp; Retention:


	Call leads and inactive users to drive sign-ups, first deposits, and reactivation using approved scripts.
	Educate users on promotions, bonuses, and new features; handle objections and close.
	Run win-back and KYC completion campaigns; schedule follow-ups and maintain CRM hygiene.


Quality &amp; Compliance:


	Adhere to communication, privacy, and responsible-gaming standards; verify user identity where required.
	Monitor and flag suspected fraud or policy violations.
	Contribute to playbooks, macros, and script improvements.


Success Metrics (KPIs)


	First Response Time &amp; Resolution Time (SLA adherence)
	CSAT/NPS and QA scores
	Conversion rates (lead &rarr; signup, signup &rarr; first deposit), reactivation rate
	KYC completion rate, AHT, and CRM data accuracy
	Attendance &amp; schedule adherence.


Requirements


	0 &ndash; 4 years in customer support/sales/inside-sales (iGame, fintech, e-commerce, or telco preferred).
	Excellent spoken &amp; written communication; confident on calls, persuasive yet empathetic.
	Comfortable with targets and incentives; strong objection handling and closing skills.
	Tech-savvy: CRM, ticketing, dialers, chat tools, spreadsheets; fast typing and documentation.
	Flexible to work evenings/weekends/major sports events on a roster.
	Languages: Fluent English; additional regional languages a plus.

Customer Support Executive Job at Naira567




        
    

        
        Naira567 is a fast-growing, Nigeria-first sports and iGame platform built for seamless play, fair odds, and fast, reliable payouts. We’re a mobile-first, remote-friendly team combining world-class technology with local insight to deliver a safe, entertaining experience for players across Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Support Executive
Job Location: Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	You will handle inbound customer queries and outbound calling to convert prospects thereby, supporting users, driving sign-ups, and elevating player satisfaction.
	This is a high-visibility, growth role with clear performance incentives for outbound conversions.


Key Responsibilities
Inbound Support:


	Respond to tickets, chats, calls, and social DMs within SLAs; resolve issues (account, KYC, deposits/withdrawals, bets, promotions, basic troubleshooting).
	Investigate and escalate complex cases to Risk, Payments, Tech, or Compliance; follow through to closure.
	Capture accurate case notes and user feedback to improve FAQs and product.


Outbound Growth & Retention:


	Call leads and inactive users to drive sign-ups, first deposits, and reactivation using approved scripts.
	Educate users on promotions, bonuses, and new features; handle objections and close.
	Run win-back and KYC completion campaigns; schedule follow-ups and maintain CRM hygiene.


Quality & Compliance:


	Adhere to communication, privacy, and responsible-gaming standards; verify user identity where required.
	Monitor and flag suspected fraud or policy violations.
	Contribute to playbooks, macros, and script improvements.


Success Metrics (KPIs)


	First Response Time & Resolution Time (SLA adherence)
	CSAT/NPS and QA scores
	Conversion rates (lead → signup, signup → first deposit), reactivation rate
	KYC completion rate, AHT, and CRM data accuracy
	Attendance & schedule adherence.


Requirements


	0 – 4 years in customer support/sales/inside-sales (iGame, fintech, e-commerce, or telco preferred).
	Excellent spoken & written communication; confident on calls, persuasive yet empathetic.
	Comfortable with targets and incentives; strong objection handling and closing skills.
	Tech-savvy: CRM, ticketing, dialers, chat tools, spreadsheets; fast typing and documentation.
	Flexible to work evenings/weekends/major sports events on a roster.
	Languages: Fluent English; additional regional languages a plus.


Nice to Have:


	Experience with KYC, payments, or risk workflows.
	Passion for sports and familiarity with betting terminology & odds.
	Prior remote work experience.
	Work Tools: CRM & ticketing (e.g., Zendesk/Freshdesk/HubSpot), dialer/VoIP, WhatsApp/Chat, Google Workspace, internal knowledge base.


Why join us?


	High-impact role at an early stage with real ownership and rapid growth potential
	Fully remote culture with performance-linked bonuses & incentives
	Opportunity to shape how millions of fans discover and enjoy sports & game in Nigeria.


What We Offer


	Fully remote setup, growth runway in a scaling team.
	Competitive base + uncapped performance incentives & bonuses for outbound conversions.
	Training, clear career paths (Exec Senior → Exec → Team Lead → Quality/Training/Operations).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, a cover letter introducing yourself in a short paragraph on how you would convince a new user to sign up on the platform and deposit.  Include your notice period and expected CTC. Send both documents to: officialnaira567@gmail.com  using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	We prefer a female candidate for this role.
	Candidates must adhere to responsible-game and data-privacy standards.
